headline: Justice Department sues California over immigration laws
subHeadline: What will come of the state, federal immigration standoff? 'The Greg Gutfeld Show' panel weighs in.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: All right. Enough. I deserve it. So, I guess fire and fury worked.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS MATTHEWS, ANCHOR, HARDBALL, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: A dramatic statement that they are talking about. Kim Jong-un is actually talking about total denuclearization of the Korean peninsula. What do you make of that suggestion?

utterances.speaker: JOSEPH CIRINCIONE, PRESIDENT, PLOUGHSHARES FUND
utterances.sentences: This is actually a moment that very few of us thought we would ever see.

utterances.speaker: JOHN ROBERTS, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: The president agreed that he will meet with Kim Jong Un, and it's difficult to overstate the historic nature of this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: John, comb your hair. But that's what normal people call good news. But what about morning beaker.

utterances.speaker: MIKA BREZEZINSKI, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Is this a deflection?

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Off course, it's a deflection. Tariffs and North Korea -- all to distract from a president didn't go through the proper channels.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry. He looks like beaker. That's all I see. And of course, the great Rachel is having a moment.

utterances.speaker: RACHEL MADDOW, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: You might think like another president in this circumstance, you can imagine a president asking himself or herself why has no other American president ever agreed to do this? Why has no sitting American president ever met with a leader from North Korea? Why has that never happened in all the decades North Korea existed as a nation? Why hasn't any other president ever done -- shouldn't I take that to mean that this might be a particularly risky or even an unwise move?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why? Why? You know, if it were another president like Obama, you would be doing cartwheels off a high dive in to a swimming pool filled with ambrosia salad.   So, in summary, if you are looking for a summary of the media's response to all of these progress, this does it. Now, obviously it pays to be skeptical about all of this, but you know, this is something that can only happen under Donald Trump. It kind of remind me of a movie.

utterances.speaker: MALE NARRATOR
utterances.sentences: In the world of uncertainty, two leaders face off in a war of words that terrified the globe.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: Rocket man is on a suicide mission for himself.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Kim Jong-un saying, I surely and definitely tame the mentally deranged US dotard with fire.

utterances.speaker: MALE NARRATOR
utterances.sentences: But when talking trash thaws the ice.

utterances.speaker: TUCKER CARLSON, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: North Korean dictator, Kim Jong-un has proposed a face to face meeting with President Trump.

utterances.speaker: MALE NARRATOR
utterances.sentences: One man will prove nukes and stones may break your bones, but words will never hurt you.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We'll see what happens.

utterances.speaker: MALE NARRATOR
utterances.sentences: While democrats shove billions in cash to tyrants, kissed commie butt in Cuba, and apologized to the world for being awesome. A man with a plan says "Enough." A huge man on a unicorn with a fitness tracker in one hand and a box of Twinkies in the other present, Donald Trump, Kim Jong-un and Dirk Benedict as Faceman. Executive Action X. Put up your nukes. Now playing in select theaters with a special home feature, Nation's Hall Monitor, I came, I saw, I tattled. Starring Brian Stelter as Brian Stelter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a feeling that's going to be a hit. All right, you have got to admit even if you don't like Trump, his effect is hard to deny. So, hard that even "Vanity Fair" admits that Donald's strategy is paying off. Fact is, to control crazy, you've got to talk crazy. Meaning, appear ready to do the unthinkable to get enemies to think twice. It's my theory, sometimes it pays to be the psycho on the block, screaming at clouds and rubbing dog poo in your hair.   Forever, we sat back and watched streets filled with bearded psychos, burning our flag and countries run by extremist nut bags, who go to them into a froth of fearful rage. But enough about Berkeley. So, we said with North Korea, we'll take your crazy and raise you triple crazy by electing Donald Trump. They didn't see that coming, did you? Of course, it's still too soon to rejoice, but what's the media's obsession now instead of that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It has raised among many people the speculation that those photographs might be intimate photographs of the President of the United States, and Mika, I'll hope as you conjure an image of that, I'll try to just urge you not to throw up in your mouth.

utterances.speaker: JAMES CORDEN, ENGLISH ACTOR
utterances.sentences: If there are naked pictures of Donald Trump, they can go, go ahead and stay hushed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Talk about body shaming, as if naked pictures of them would be any better. Fact is, after a certain age we are all old and weird without our clothes on. That's why I don't own a mirror.  The human body is not designed for wear and tear. It's the worst designed product since the spork. But this stormy story is not sticking with the people, just the media. Why? Because we know Donald and Donald knows Donald. Even he said he's no role model. Finding out Donald Trump slept with an adult film star is like finding out Mike Pence didn't. It's not going to blow your mind. And besides, a grown man that's attracted to porn stars? Welcome to biology.  Anyway, I can see it now, Stormy Daniels, CNN contributor. Of course, if the media still can't take a Donald Trump joke, spending days spreading over his comments on the Chinese president having a job for life.

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE O'DONNELL, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: The president of the United States seems to approve of the president of China making himself a president for life and the president seems to be suggesting that he too would like to be a president for life, and we don't know if the American president is making a joke or really means it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Come on, you know he's kidding. He just sneaked some of the rails against us. Unemployment dipped to its lowest in 50 years or maybe you don't think Trump is kidding. Maybe you think he's dead serious about everything he says. Sounds like you need this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you have trouble understanding basic humor?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: China is great and Xi is a great gentleman. He is now president for life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Did you hear that? He just praised the Chinese president for getting rid of term limits and he said we should, too.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Dude, it was a joke.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, that is what an evil dictator says.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Please help me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Sure thing. You should try "Laugh It Off".

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Sounds dangerous. What is it?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: "Laugh It Off" is a spray you apply directly to the face that penetrates all the way to your brain to help you understand when the president is and isn't joking. You could preserve your sanity.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: My co-worker used to scoff at the President twits all day and it bummed him out. Then I made him try "Laugh It Off". Now look at him? Thanks, "Laugh It Off", I guess.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you believe that North Korea's recent willingness to talk is sincere? And to what do you owe this recent openness to talk?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Me. Nobody got that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Don't worry, Mr. President, I get. Thanks, "Laugh It Off".

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So, try "Laugh It Off" today. So, you can go from this to this. Side effects may include improving (inaudible) world view.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, let us welcome tonight's guest. Doctor, doctor, give us the news. I've got a bad case of love and Drew, host of the radio show, Dr. Drew Midday Live. Dr. Drew Pinsky. And like a loaf of French bread, she's often half in the bag, co-host of "Dr. Drew Midday Live," Lauren Sivan. And her favorite color is death, National Review reporter Katherine Timpf. And he flosses with the transatlantic cable, Impact wrestler and my master sidekick, Tyrus. All right, let's go to the expert, the doctor. What do you think of my theory that by pretending to be unpredictable, or maybe not pretending, but actually being unpredictable, it worked with Kim. DREW PINSKY, HOST, "DR. DREW MIDDAY LIVE": Well, if it's your theory, Greg, it must be right, first, let's start with that. But yes, I just think Trump is very predictable in being unpredictable. I think he always takes these extreme scary points of view, lets people react, so it creates a lot of chaos, then thrives on it, and then he is driving back towards some place he actually wants to go using game theory.  He is a pretty good game theoretician, but initially, he says very, very scary things and goes to these extremes where you think he's losing his mind and lo and behold, he reels it back to something where you are happy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know -- everybody talks about game theory and I don't -- game theory just means looking at everything like it's a game?

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: No, no, it's a little more complicated than that. Just a little more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, well, you know what, next we'll do an entire hour on that, certainly not tonight. Okay, Lauren. You have got to kind of admit that, I mean, he's putting the squeeze on North Korea. This might -- I mean, look, the guy could be full of crap, the North Korean dictator, so you know.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: She knows somebody that who knows him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh really?

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who?

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Well.

utterances.speaker: LAUREN SIVAN, CO-ANCHOR, DR. DREW MIDDAY SHOW
utterances.sentences: A friend went to school with Kim Jong-un.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh really? Tell me about it. Is he a rational human being? He is a rational actor?

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: When he was a kid in school, he loved his video games, didn't have many friends and according to this friend, grunted a lot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Grunted. Wait, are you a gruntist? Because I grunt all the time.

utterances.speaker: GEORGE MURDOCH, TYRUS, PROFESSIONAL WRESTLER
utterances.sentences: Now, I am.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: But the thing about this, he's one of those kids who is just playing video games, sort of withdrawn and that's who he is dealing with, and.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: And now, he's a leader.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: But it's going to be a one-on-one sort of negotiation between those two.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: By the way, he sees the glass half full with this situation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: This is why we have a show.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: If the Twitter preview is anything to come.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: They are going to have a (inaudible) contest within 20 minutes of meeting each other. We know that's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And that's a problem? I don't think that's a problem. You know, I do think it's a problem for the record. You know, Kat, obviously something like this elevates, I guess, elevates Kim's stature in the world by having a world leader meet. Is that a really bad thing? But it's something that has to happen? Kind of.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, NATIONAL REVIEW REPORTER
utterances.sentences: See, I was somebody who was not all about the talk of a preemptive nuclear strike. So, I am going to be for the talk about talking, and yes, I guess, maybe, but it really is the best way to go. What I have seen though is so many people who are against the talk of nuclear war. This is going to be a disaster, which I agree with, who are now saying, I'm against this talking. This is going to be a disaster. So, it's like, okay, you are not really concerned about North Korea, you just want to be against whatever Donald Trump is doing, but I think if it happens, I would commend him for it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, all right, Tyrus, from your experience as a professional wrestler. I believe that you might be the expert in this face off. I mean, it's kind of like professional wrestlers, you've got the little scary kid and you've got that big hulking guy.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Which one is the big hulking guy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know anymore.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: We'll give it to Donald, he's taller. Mr. President is taller. You know what? Let's forget all of that. Let's say they meet and Donald Trump denuclearizes North Korea. So, he gets a Nobel Peace prize, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, yes, I think so. But they probably won't. No, they're going to go give it to Obama.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Again.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: But, can you just imagine CNN having to report that? I guarantee you, they will be doing opiates live on CNN.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They will need "Laugh It Off".

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's definitely -- I mean, I think -- if you're going to talk to him, and I think this is probably what will happen, the alternative is worse for North Korea because those sanctions are really hurting them. They're hurting him. His federal reserves are almost out. That's his money.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's losing his money and also, they're targeting companies and he's looking for a way out and this might be a way out. But again, you can't trust a guy like that. You've got to, you know.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: But you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: The world we live in now, people get political advice from a wrestler, a real estate mogul is our president and our voice of reason and virtue is a porn star. So, I mean, why not?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, that's a positive note to end this.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's great. We've made it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We have. We have made it. Coming up, the golden state makes the DOJ irate. That's next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do we need sanctuary cities from sanctuary cities? The Justice Department is suing the State of California over its so-called sanctuary laws. The DOJ says, those laws obstruct federal immigration laws. Jeff Sessions called out the Mayor of Oakland who warned illegals last month that the Feds were coming.

utterances.speaker: JEFF SESSIONS, ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: How dare you needlessly endanger the lives our law enforcement officers to promote a radical open borders agenda.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, the mayor of Oakland gave it back to him. I bet she said, "How dare you."

utterances.speaker: LIBBY SCHAAF, MAYOR OF OAKLAND, CALIFORNIA
utterances.sentences: How dare you distort the reality about declining violent crime in a diverse sanctuary city like Oakland, California to advance your racist agenda.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But wait, even Linda Rondstadt's ex-boyfriend, Jerry Brown piled on.

utterances.speaker: JERRY BROWN, CALIFORNIA GOVERNOR
utterances.sentences: This is unprecedented for the chief law enforcement of the United States to come out to California and act more like Fox News than a law enforcement officer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Fox News, you wish. You wish, whoever you are. But what's being lost in all of this? The Justice Department isn't doing anything other than enforcing the laws that are already on the books. If you are going to ignore a law because you think it's unjust, then anyone can.  And that next law could can against your beliefs, so careful what you're daring people to do. Personally, I like my own sanctuary city where I can do anything I want whenever I want like dress up like a tiger and work out in the park. I was banned from that park. I don't blame them, but it was worth it. Lauren, the sanctuary city, if you could have one, is there any kind you would like for yourself?

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: Well, I'll be honest, at first when I heard California was going create sanctuary cities, I was excited. I thought maybe was like a discount spa where I could get massages, but now, I realized that it's not what they are doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: And even though I am not a huge fan of Jeff Sessions, I was right there behind him saying, "You are obstructing the law. You are giving me the vapors, California.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How dare you? How dare you?

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: How dare you? How dare you, sugar?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How dare you, good sir. How dare you, I would have a duel if I could operate a gun.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: I will take you on anytime.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Then it's a date. We'll meet on the veranda.

utterances.speaker: SIVAN
utterances.sentences: Gregory.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We'll meet duel lips. I don't know where this is going, doctor?

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I was thinking more about foghorn and leghorn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're the California man.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: It's a big deal. It's all we talk about in our radio show. It's a big, big, big deal. This is insurrection. This is a disregard for the federal law, and that is unconstitutional. We fought a Civil War over this very issue we're talking about, nullification. The Civil War started because President Lincoln attempted to provision Fort Sumter, which was his duty as a federal senior officer. He provisioned Fort Sumter. South Carolina fired on them. That was the Civil War. Now here we have California going, we are going to disregard these federal laws no matter what. They can't no matter what. They will lose this suit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't even know that about the Civil War. I should have paid attention.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: You know, to be fair, it all started with a nullification crisis in Andrew Jackson's administration. Forget it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are a doctor. Come on.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: I know, I shouldn't be talking about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, I know, Tyrus, Tyrus, Tyrus. Thought?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Well, the Civil War was really important for me, so I'm really glad it worked out because I am working I am not chained to this chair right now, so that's really cool. I grew up in California and it's always something, but this -- I just wish the sanctuary cities were somewhere else. And the great wall, the current one, whenever he is, he always says the same thing. It used to be like Montana, New Mexico, Alaska -- those would be great sanctuary cities because you actually get out here and you've got to work and it's cold. The environment is spread out. There's nobody there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, they all pick this.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because I have a theory, the reason why these -- and here's the thing, any time, if you noticed liberals only want to help you when they lead stuff, and everyone is just like -- and all these big cities, the ones that are sanctuary cities, it's also the cities where most of the maids and the gardeners and the stuff like that work because they don't want to pay them. They don't have to pay them the same rates that they pay American citizens. So, it's just convenient to me that they are so worried about these sanctuary cities and they're protecting the rights of these immigrants, but they are actually protecting their own.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To immigrants.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: All they are doing is protecting the rights of convicted felons, convicted felons cannot be deported. We've been saying, (inaudible) what we should do with the illegal immigrants.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hope they do that when I am convicted. It's funny -- it's discriminating against the American felon. Like the American felon should be first in line.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: That's exactly what.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's always -- so the illegal felons get to cut in line? I can't (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: All the way to the front of the line.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, Kat, thoughts.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's my question. Obviously, it's a little bit of a complicated legal issue because you also can't force the state and local police to do the federal government's job, but the fact that someone can be a violent criminal and be here illegally, I mean, you don't get to stay. That absolutely would be ridiculous. I can't believe that anybody has a different view than that. It just doesn't make any sense.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I realized my ideal sanctuary city is one where no one can be taller than me. So, when you come in, it's going to be just like an amusement park, it will and cutout of me and it will say, "You have to be short than Greg."

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'm the only one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're the only one.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I will protest this with all that I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Scott Adams has a good point that Democrats come up with half a plan. They come up with a half a plan for everything. It's like, they go, "Oh, we should be compassionate about people to stay here," but when you try to create a process or a structure, they go, "We didn't get that far." They always start with the half a plan which is why it always end in disaster.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY
utterances.sentences: Or that's unfair. How dare you. How dare you, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Got to go. Don't go anywhere. Still to come. Free speech comes under fire once again on our college campuses. We report, you throw up.

utterances.speaker: MARIANNE RAFFERTY, CORRESPONDENT, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Live from America's News Headquarters, I am Marianne Rafferty. We're learning more about the three women killed during that day-long hostage situation in Northern California. The victims were Pathway Home Executive Director, Christine Loeber; Clinical Director, Jennifer Golick, and Jennifer Gonzales, a Clinical Psychologist. Gonzalez was seven months pregnant. She was married a year ago and was planning to celebrate her anniversary this weekend. The suspected gunman, Albert Wong was found dead along with the three hostages. It's unclear whether the former soldier targeted his victims or how he died. Friends say Wong had a hard time adjusting to life after returning from Afghanistan in 2013. There are reports that he was asked to leave the Pathway program which helps veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder. A woman who had been as legal guardian says he was calm and soft-spoken. I am the Marianne Rafferty, now back to the "The Greg Gutfeld Show."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was no bite and all bark at Lewis & Clark. Students at Lewis & Clark College they shouted down conservative philosopher, Christina Hoff Sommers at a speech she gave at the university law school. I called the student activists but they didn't seem that organized.

utterances.speaker: GROUP
utterances.sentences: What side are you on, friend? What side are you on? No (inaudible). We will fight for justice, (inaudible). What side are you on, friend? What side are you on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They didn't put any effort into that. It's not even catchy. If you're going to shout down a major thinker like Christina Hoff Sommers, be assertive. Believe in your message. Like these guys. See, they are organized. Meanwhile at Middlebury College, a year ago, students there violently protested against Conservative Speaker, Charles Murray, you remember this, the professor who invited Murray ended up with a concussion. So, a year later, the school paper wrote about it. They editor felt they had to explain why Murray's picture was on the front page of the paper. Why? Because they felt that Murray's image would be traumatizing for the students. A picture of him. What a bunch of ass hats. For more on this, we go to one of the student's parents. You should be lucky to have him as a parent. Kat, you've been writing about this stuff for like 30 years. It's amazing.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Before I was born. I'm not 30 yet.

utterances.speaker: GUTSFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, this debate still exists in America. Is it over?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It's over. I mean, the only time it's traumatizing to see a photo is if it's your of your ex-boyfriend and he is smiling. So, unless these students dated Charles Murray, which maybe they did, maybe a couple of them dated and things were going great and the next thing you know, all of a sudden, he left them then I completely understand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's dumped them over for low IQ.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I completely understand why they would be reacting this way. Otherwise, they have no excuse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Speeches are not violence. Photos of people just sitting there are not violence and these kids really need to grow up and get over it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus? Are these students going to get jobs in the real world if pictures -- like a photo scare them?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Okay, let's ease back a minute. First of all, can you imagine the protesting planner -- the guy who put it together, while they were doing that. You know, he was sitting in the van going, "Oh, my god." I told them a million times to shout us, not we. Like, the choreographer apologized to everyone, "We're going to come back out and we're going to try this again." Like, it was really literally -- protest. There was even no effort in it. And it's not the students. It is the administrator or whoever was in charge of that, the person. "Oh, this is going to hurt the children." Really? That's going to hurt the children. An old man, side-profiled, and if you look at all of their Facebooks and Instagram, they've got a ton of selfies on there that will scare the hell out of you. Some old guy who didn't even know he was taken a picture, who looked like he was holding onto his last breath. utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So I go through this black hole and nothing from my past comes with me?

utterances.utterance: It's for you Pat, it's for you. You would love to erase your past and live forever. Because you talk about death all the time.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

I would love to erase my past, it's what I keep telling my therapist what I want to do and he keeps telling me, "Kat that's not possible." Well you are wrong Dr. Elliot, it is possible. I'm going to fire him and hire one of these math doctors to talk to about my problems, because they are the ones with all the real solutions. No offense, Drew.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know I -- there's a really dark part of this, okay. If you are living an infinite number of lives, there's a super downside to this. utterances.speaker: PINSKY

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well that's right. I think there are parallel universes right now. Plus, here's another theory as I stretch the segment out, since nobody has.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm just waiting for you to finish this because I just got upset at you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This makes accidents more valuable and terrifying because, if you can live forever, the only thing that's going to kill you is an accident, so you'll never go outside. Because if you go out -- it would really suck if you could live forever but you died at age 20, because, you know, it's safe -- on you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Not to mention that Greg, but you're just assuming everyone's going to have great lives on the other side. What if you're Joe Schmoe the guy who's like middle management and can't get out of it for eternity? You know, living is better than dying and second, are we sure this isn't just a guy who can't get a date and he got kicked off Instagram for an inappropriate picture so he made up, there's this thing -- of the universe, you can go and just leave this past behind because nobody will swipe left on his tender, you know what I'm saying? Are we sure this isn't just some mathematician who's just really lonely and has made some mistakes?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I will find my new doctor.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.utterance: We talked about.

utterances.speaker: PINSKY

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, anyway -- that was interesting. We went from black holes to porn stars. Coming up, he is suspected of being a Russian spy but has no idea why. Carter Page is here. I have asked him the question on everyone's mind, "Why am I so handsome?"

utterances.utterance: The FBI thought he was a spy, but was it all a lie? Here with me now is former Trump Campaign Advisor, Carter Page. Hey, Carter. My first question, every time I see you interviewed, you are always smiling. Why are you always smiling?

utterances.utterance: I have that spray tan.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: It works.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do get a lot of fiber? You seem kind of relaxed all the time?

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, because it doesn't seem -- like I always think, when I look at you, you don't seem like a spy to me, which means you could be an amazing spy, right? You're just so happy.

utterances.utterance: Well, actually Laura Ingraham picked up on a bit of it because she figured out where I was. Our campaign committee met with then candidate Trump one time. I was very, very far away. She figured out where.

utterances.utterance: Where were you?

utterances.utterance: Well, the North Koreans, they offered a much better deal. It was only $11 billion from the Russians. They had jacked up a little bit, so that's -- heading in that direction, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, why are they after you?

utterances.utterance: I think it's because, just.

utterances.utterance: You're very James Bond.

utterances.utterance: Well, I think you know, I knew some of the people in the Clinton orbit and they -- I think they figured out I'd be a pretty easy-going guy in terms of throwing out all these crazy stories with some of their collaborators in and outside of government, so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what is interesting about this whole Trump phenomenon is that there are people like you, it was like two years ago, you were an obscure guy, you know, eating Cheerios in a bathtub, watching reruns of "Friends" until 6:00 in the morning.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: How'd you know?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I have a camera. I have a camera in your -- I am actually the.

utterances.utterance: That's the FISA way.

utterances.utterance: I am actually the Russian spy. But then, there's this political earthquake and everything has changed. utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: Actually, that Wikipedia page showed up within hours of the fake news stories at the DNC and the Clinton campaign managed to plan, September 2016, so you're right, I was definitely a nobody before then, but.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now, you're a frightened somebody. Are you followed a lot -- like followed by mysterious people in overcoats? Perhaps Lou Dobbs? Lou Dobbs tends to follow people in overcoats. Very strange habit he has. But I mean, like you have to -- I am sure you have to move around a lot because.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: Well, I think because of the domestic terror threats that I was offering from a long time. But that's the beauty of all these memos that are coming out. I think people are starting to realize what a complete joke this whole process has been. So, that's a perfect place to be discussing here on this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I am very glad that you showed up here. And, as I ask the hard-hitting questions that nobody else does, like are you a spy? Nobody asked you that. By the way, where is your lawyer? Like your lawyer allows you just to go everywhere? He's having a nervous breakdown.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: Actually, I have been studying the law. You know, I was never very interested in the law. I always followed it and was sort of.

utterances.utterance: I don't know if that's a really good criteria for defending yourself.

utterances.utterance: Well, you know, with the Civil Rights abuses I suffered, they really became a great interest of mine. But you can imagine how that went over, so I ended up getting the axe.

utterances.speaker: PAGE

utterances.utterance: Are you going to go? I might see you there. I don't know. Who

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: A few people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Interesting. Russians?

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: Definitely.

utterances.utterance: Why do you spend so much time in Russia anyway? Those nesting dolls? Everybody loves those nesting dolls.

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.utterance: Are you selling like illegal nesting dolls? Is that what this is?

utterances.speaker: PAGE
utterances.utterance: That's actually the only theory that hasn't been tried as of yet. They may need to look into that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think you've been trafficking illegal nesting dolls. I happen to collect nesting dolls. By the way, I have one more question. The running back, from the 49'ers from 20 years ago. My mind is blown. Carter Page, always a pleasure to see you for the first time. I hope something bad does not happen to you. I hope that you safely get to your car and back to your hotel at 43rd Street and Fifth. I'm joking. That was to throw the sense of. That's it, it's the best western downtown. All right, I don't hold grudges, but if you leave now, I will never forgive you.
